column1: Safety Harbor is a city on the west shore of Tampa Bay in Pinellas County
column3: United States. It was settled in 1823 and incorporated in 1917. The population was 16
column4: 884 at the 2010 census.It is governed by an elected Mayor and City Commission. City governmental departments are administered by a City Manager
column5: who is appointed by the City Commission.

column1: == Geography ==
Safety Harbor is located at 28°0.3′N 82°41.7′W (28.0047
column2: -82.6953). The harbor or bay of the same name on which it is located is the nearly-landlocked far northwestern extension of Tampa Bay
column3: and the city is located on the west side of that bay.

column1: According to the U.S. Census Bureau
column2: the city has a total area of 5.1 square miles (13 km2)
column3: of which 4.9 square miles (13 km2) is land and 0.1 square miles (0.26 km2) (2.57%) is water.

column1: Safety Harbor's tree-lined streets and quaint
column2: "small-town" appearance are unusual in heavily urbanized Pinellas County.

column1: The CSX railroad branch line from Tampa to St. Petersburg bisects Safety Harbor. Passenger trains last used the line in 1984.

column1: == Early history ==
The area has been inhabited since the Stone Age. In June 2008
column3: 000-year-old spearhead was found at Marshall Street Park.  The inhabitants of the area at the time of Spanish exploration were the Tocobaga people
column4: who lived in villages around Tampa Bay. The adaptation of this culture relied on wild resources.  Safety Harbor sites have yielded pottery
column7: and stone.  The Tocobaga were known for constructing various ceremonial and communal mounds to bury the dead.  Most of these mounds were destroyed in the early 1900s due to development.  However
column8: one of these ceremonial mounds is still visible in Safety Harbor's Phillippe Park (see photo).  Shells found in these mounds were used to pave city streets.

column1: In 1528 Spanish explorer Pánfilo de Narváez landed in the area
column2: followed by Hernando de Soto in 1539. Safety Harbor (formerly known as Worth's Harbor and Green's Springs) was first homesteaded by Count Odet Philippe
column3: a French nobleman who is credited with introducing the grapefruit to Florida in 1823. The name Safety Harbor originated from the early 18th century
column4: when pirates were a substantial influence in the area. Once ships reached this area of the bay
column5: all threats from pirates were gone
column6: and it was commonly referred to as a "Safe Harbor".

column1: == Springs ==
Safety Harbor is the home of the historic Espiritu Santo Springs
column3: a natural mineral spring. Its waters were given this name in 1539 by the Spanish explorer Hernando de Soto
column4: who was supposedly searching for the mythical "Fountain of Youth". Prior to the Spanish exploration of Florida
column5: the Tocobaga and Timuquan tribes are believed to have fished and bathed in the spring's waters.

column1: In the twentieth century
column2: Espiritu Santo water was bottled and sold commercially
column3: and later a health spa and hotel were built over the springs. The Safety Harbor Resort and Spa
column5: continues to be a prominent visitor attraction in Pinellas County. In 1964
column6: the site was designated a Historical Landmark by the U.S. Department of the Interior and

column1: == Schools ==

There are two public schools within the city: Safety Harbor Elementary School for grades 1–5 and Safety Harbor Middle School (Home of the Seahawks) for grades 6–8. The middle school was rebuilt in 2004 and now has five buildings surrounding a central courtyard
column2: with adjacent sports fields and a regulation track field. As a joint project between the city of Safety Harbor and the school
column3: the field and track facilities are open to the community. As of 2007
column4: Safety Harbor Middle School has an enrollment of 1
column5: 370 students.Safety Harbor Middle School also has award-winning MEGSSS (Mathematics Education for Gifted Secondary School Students) and an IMAST (Integrated Math and Science Technologies) programs.

column1: The nearest school for grades 9–12 is Countryside High School in Clearwater.
Espiritu Santo Catholic School: Private Elementary School: PreK3 – 8th Grade. Free VPK. Gifted
column3: and Music Programs. Tuition Assistance Available. All Faiths Welcome. It got the 2019 national Blue ribbon award.  Address: 2405-A Philippe Parkway

column1: == Notable people ==
Matt Geiger - retired American professional basketball player; attended Safety Harbor Middle and Countryside High schools.
Alan Lomax -  one of the great American field collectors of folk music of the 20th century. He was also a folklorist
Dave Martinez - retired MLB baseball player and current manager for the Washington Nationals.
Taffy Nivert - singer songwriter
Robin Zander - lead singer and rhythm guitarist for the rock band Cheap Trick.
